page.title: 13ATTITUDES IN SHALBOURNE
page.content: There is strong support for the local {school:}most children attend it or would if appropriate; people are content with the school, feeling it is very important to the village. A very high percentage of those asked voted at the last{Parish Council}Election and all thought they would vote next time; most could name nearly half the present Council and had some idea of the topics it deals with; about half feel it does a good but limited job - half are unsure. Few of those asked attend the local{church}other than on special days, many preferring to spend Sundays elsewhere or on other pursuits however, all these infrequent worship- pers still consider a church + priest vital to a village! All claimed to support/enjoy local events; most liked {village life}although less so if they had no transport.
